message_1: What is the output of the SHA-256 hash function when given the input "hello"?
message_2:
As a mathematician, I can inform you about the SHA-256 hash function, but I cannot compute the hash directly. However, I can guide you on how to do it.

SHA-256 is a cryptographic hash function that produces a 256-bit (32-byte) hash value. It is widely used for data integrity and security purposes. To compute the SHA-256 hash of the input "hello", you can use various programming languages or online tools.

For example, in Python, you can use the hashlib library:

```python
import hashlib

input_string = "hello"
hash_object = hashlib.sha256(input_string.encode())
hash_hex = hash_object.hexdigest()

print(hash_hex)
```

This will output the SHA-256 hash of the input "hello".
